Here's the extracted text from the SAT page:

---

**Section 1, Module 2: Reading and Writing**

**Directions**

Branching in Jurisprudential Schools is one of the hundreds of thousands of manuscripts that have survived from roughly the sixteenth century to the present _____ being passed down through private libraries in the city of Timbuktu, Mali. Many of these manuscripts can be found at the Al-Wangari Manuscript Library.

**17 Mark for Review**

Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

A) day by  
B) day; by  
C) day. By  
D) day by,  

---

questions.passage_text: Branching in Jurisprudential Schools is one of the hundreds of thousands of manuscripts that have survived from roughly the sixteenth century to the present _____ being passed down through private libraries in the city of Timbuktu, Mali. Many of these manuscripts can be found at the Al-Wangari Manuscript Library.
questions.question_text: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
questions.explanation: The question tests punctuation and sentence structure conventions in Standard English.
